title: CA logo and website sans serif
content:
Hi

Can anyone identify the font used by ca on their website and in their logo?

[http://www.ca.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.ca.com/ "http://www.ca.com/")

Thanks!

 [‹ (x) Made To Scale unicase book cover type - Filosofia {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29190 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Union Bank script logo - hand lettered {Marc O} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29181 "Go to next forum topic")
author: darren

comments.content:
It seems to be Helvetica.

- Lex

Nope, that’s not Helvetica. The “ca” logo is somewhere between [Univers](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.121025.0.0) and [Franklin Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.217.0.0), and the sans serif used elsewhere in the website is [Whitney](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/whitney/index.html)-esque.
